title: Making a backend in Java [Spring]: Setup
summary: Having decided to write a backend in Java, let's look at how we would start  a backend project in Spring - the most popular web server framework for Java.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Hack at UCI 2024: Product Design & Web Dev Intro
summary: For Hack at UCI 2024's first workshop of the event, we'll go over basic product design and then use what we've learned there to translate into a basic web app. The focus here will be on the various parts that exist and how they interact with each other to form a cohesive app.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Web Dev 3D [Three.js]: Custom Objects
summary: Learn how to add your own custom objects into our Three.js scene. I'll provide a GLTF file for y'all's to try out.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Web Dev 3D [Three.js]: Basics
summary: Learn about 3d web development with three.js - the most popular 3d web  development library.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Web Dev Fundamentals: Events
summary: Events are the main drivers for interactivity in the web. Let's take a  look at a couple of them and how we can react to them as developers.

title: Making a URL shortener in Python
summary: This is the practical tutorial after the designing-a-url-shortener article in which we implement the design specified in Python using Flask.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Design@UCI Intern Starter Tasks: Setup
summary: For Design@UCI internal use. Anyone is free to read these tutorials but you won't have perms to edit the codebase, obviously. These are the set up instructions so we can get started on our first tasks!

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Design@UCI Intern Starter Tasks: Adding Your Profile
summary: For Design@UCI internal use. Anyone is free to read these tutorials but you won't have perms to edit the codebase, obviously. Here, our first task will be to edit our board profiles. In doing so, you'll become familiar with how developers within teams can collaborate on a single project with Git/Github

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Design@UCI Intern Starter Tasks: Making PR's on Github
summary: For Design@UCI internal use. Anyone is free to read these tutorials but you won't have perms to edit the codebase, obviously. We'll be learning how to submit a PR to get our changes reviewed and merged into the main code base.

https://ryqn.dev

summary: For Hack at UCI 2023's first workshop of the event, we'll go over basic product design and then use what we've learned there to translate into a basic web app. The focus here will be on the various parts that exist and how they interact with each other to form a cohesive app.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Design at UCI Fall 2023: Intro to Frontend Development
summary: This is Design at UCI's Fall 2023 event: Introduction to Frontend Development. We'll go over the basic of how to write HTML, CSS, and JS and learn the fundamental concepts.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Zothacks 2023: Intro to Web Design
summary: Part two of Zothack's two part web development workshop where we show the process  of developing an recipe finding application from scratch. This workshop  focuses on the design aspect of web development and mostly covers design fundamentals and how to implement them in CSS

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Zothacks 2023: Intro to Web Development
summary: Part one of Zothack's two part web development workshop where we show the process  of developing an recipe finding application from scratch. This workshop  focuses on the engineering part of web development and mostly covers just HTML and Javascript.
